news_header: A young woman named Matilda Campbell was rescued after being trapped upside down between boulders for seven hours while hiking in Australia.
news_text: Matilda Campbell fell into a three-metre crevice in New South Wales' Hunter Valley while trying to retrieve her mobile phone during a hike. She was trapped for over an hour before rescuers arrived, leading to a challenging seven-hour rescue operation that involved moving boulders. Despite the ordeal, she sustained only minor injuries and expressed gratitude to her rescuers, although she did not recover her phone.
